messages.title: Action on the economy
messages.content: We support families and businesses, strengthening the recovery and promoting jobs. We have tough plans to halve the deficit in four years. The action taken is working - the rate of unemployment, business failures and home repossessions have been a lot lower than in the Conservative recession of the 1990s.

messages.title: Protecting frontline services
messages.content: We promise a one-week cancer diagnosis and free personal care for the elderly with highest needs. We have provided since 1997 - 89,000 extra nurses, 44,000 extra doctors & 42,000 extra teachers. 4,000 new schools built & 3,500 Sure Start centres. We help millions of families with the Child Tax Credit and over £3 million children now have a Child Trust Fund.

messages.title: Protecting frontline policing
messages.content: New guarantees on response times and a pledge that your neighbourhood policing team spends at least 80% of its time on the beat in your community. Crime is down by over a third since 1997 in part thanks to 17,000 more police, and 16,000 PCSOs.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Support families and businesses, promote job growth, halve the deficit in four years, lower rates of unemployment, business failures, and home repossessions than in the past.
One-week cancer diagnosis, free personal care for elderly with highest needs, huge increase in healthcare professionals, and significant investment in child health and education.
Improve policing response times, ensure police spend 80% of time in community, reduce crime by over a third since 1997 through increasing police workforce.

issues.economy: Tough plans to halve the deficit in four years, support for families and businesses, action resulting in lower unemployment, business failures, and home repossessions.
issues.education: Built 4,000 new schools and established 3,500 Sure Start centres.
issues.health: One-week cancer diagnosis promised, significant increase in healthcare professionals, free personal care for the most needy elderly.
issues.socialWelfare: Helping millions of families with Child Tax Credit and over £3 million children with Child Trust Fund.

images.caption: Labour vs Conservatives comparison on policies such as the economy, frontline services, and policing.
